artist: Artist: School of Joseph Mallord William Turner R.A.; Artist: (attributed) George Harley
description: Sketchbook of 1844 containing 11 drawings in pencil and water color of Greece attributed to Turner, and bearing titles purported to be in his handwriting.  The locations include the Plain of Marathon, Sparta, Temple of Minerva, Corfu, Cornith, Athens, the Hellespont and other scenes.
medium: Graphite and watercolor on white wove paper
title: Sketchbook:  Greece
